column4: Hi everyone. I need to solve a wifi card issue within four hours, or else I won't have a connection for two weeks.
lol. what is the issue? and what card?
okay sounds like you have either not configured your secutiry properly for the AP or you have an incompatibility between the card and the AP
I don't have security on my AP, it's open. And the router is a linksys as well. I actually had this same setup working before I nuked Ubuntu and later reinstalled it.
okay, if it's open, then that is definately not the problem. open always works. i was about to recommend trying it like that
it's a tricky one alright. can you get it working with any livecd?
Nope. I think the broadcom driver made it into the kernel in 6.06.1 Before that, it wouldn't work, and I had to run a program called bcm43xx-fwcutter to drop the drivers in /lib/firmware
it sounds as if before when it worked you used the firmware from the windows drivers? ie the proprietry firmware, but now you are using a totally different open source one?
so perhaps you should continue to use the proprietry one (and try the open source one periodcally to see if it works)
But I'm not sure if the kernel will let me override its built in drivers
it should be possible to disable the kernel driver
did you use ndiswrapper with the old version? or kernel driver + copied firmware?
best bet is to downgrade kernel version then... unless it was a really old kernel
i mean if you want to get it working fast. ideally you want to get the newer driver working of course
nozorro: /etc/timezone should be a symlink to something in /usr/share/zoneinfo
